questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the subordinating conjunction?

choices.answer: Whether I move away or not, we will always be friends.
Whether I move away or not we will always be friends.
Whether I move, away or not, we will always be friends
Whether I move away or not we, will always be friends.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a coordinating conjunction combining two independent clauses?

choices.answer: Call for me tomorrow and you will find me a grave man.
Call for me, tomorrow, and you will find me a grave man.
Call for me tomorrow, and you will find me a grave man.
Call for me tomorrow and, you will find me a grave man.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a coordinating conj combing an independent and dependent clause?

choices.answer: I do not want to go to the opera, nor the ballet.
I do not want to go to the opera nor the ballet.
I, do not want to go to the opera, nor the ballet.
I do not want to go, to the opera, nor the ballet.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a subordinating conjunction?

choices.answer: He discovered a new planet, after his endeavor to the moon.
He discovered, a new planet after his endeavor to the moon.
He discovered a new planet after, his endeavor to the moon.
He discovered a new planet after his endeavor to the moon.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a coordinating conjunction with items in a list?

choices.answer: Her research is considered bold, courageous, and innovative.
Her research is considered bold, courageous and innovative.
Her research is considered bold courageous and innovative.
Her research is considered bold courageous, and innovative.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a coordinating conjunction to combine two items?

choices.answer: Zora Neal Hurston was a non conformist, and an individual.
Zora Neal Hurston was a non conformist and an individual.
Zora Neal Hurston was a non conformist, and, an individual.
Zora Neal Hurston was a non conformist and, an individual.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a subordinating conjunction?

choices.answer: How can we be expected to succeed without opportunities?
How are we expected to succeed, without opportunites?
How can we be expected to succeed without, opportunities?
How can we, be expected to succeed without opportunities?

questions.question: Why is this sentence correct:  Wherever you go, I will follow you.

choices.answer: Subordinating conj in the middle = comma in the middle
Subordinating conj at the beginning = comma in the middle

questions.question: Why is this sentence correct: Jimmy Carter was President, and he later became a philanthropist.

choices.answer: comma + FANBOYS = combine 2 independent clauses
comma + FANBOYS = combine independent clause & phrase

questions.question: What type of conjunction is being used:  I enjoy watching football, but I'm better at soccer.

choices.answer: Subordinating Conjunction
Coordinating Conjunction

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the subordinating conjunction?

choices.answer: Before Lou baked the cake; he made sure he had frosting.
Before Lou baked the cake he made sure he had frosting.
Before Lou baked the cake, he made sure he had frosting.
Before Lou baked the cake. He made sure he had frosting.

questions.question: Identify the subordinating conjunction: Whenever your friends come over, they leave a mess.

choices.answer: Come
Whenever
They
Leave

questions.question: Does a comma belong before the bolded word: Lord Voldemort, and I spun around and got dizzy.

choices.answer: Yes
No

questions.question: Does comma belong before bolded word: Jane didn't see me in the crowd, so I called her name.

choices.answer: yes
no

questions.question: What's the FANBOY doing: Lucy jumped on the trampoline and rolled down the grassy hill.

choices.answer: connecting subjects
connecting objects
connecting verbs
connecting complete thoughts

questions.question: What's the FANBOY doing:  Craig needs to get here soon, or we will have to leave without him.

choices.answer: connecting subjects
connecting objects
connecting verbs
connecting complete thoughts

questions.question: What's the FANBOY doing:  Katniss needs a notebook and pencils for class today.

choices.answer: connecting subjects
connecting objects
connecting verbs
connecting complete thoughts

questions.question: What is the FANBOY doing: Lisa Simpson and her puppy are entering a beauty contest together.

choices.answer: connecting subjects
connecting objects
connecting verbs
connecting complete thoughts

questions.question: The job of a subordinating conjunction is to:

choices.answer: connect a complete and incomplete thought
connect two complete thoughts
connect two different subjects
connect two incomplete thoughts

questions.question: Which sentence uses the proper punctuation?

choices.answer: A) Since it is snowing, the kids want to go outside.
B) The kids want to go outside since it is snowing.
C) Since it is snowing the kids want to go outside.
D) Both A & B
